forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. Southeast wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn creeps across Downtown San Francisco, the city awakens under a serene shroud of partly cloudy skies, a prelude to a day that promises clarity and gentle warmth. The air is crisp, with the chill lingering ever so slightly—a reminder of the night before, where temperatures dipped to a brisk 46 degrees. However, come midday, one can expect a comfortable rise to a high of around 62, tapering off to about 58 as afternoon settles in. Winds will whisper gently from the north-northwest, moving at a leisurely pace of 3 to 7 mph.

Though the forecast indicates mostly sunny conditions, one might notice hints of fog lingering close to the waters, possibly hugging the Golden Gate Bridge and casting a delicate veil over the bay. Yet, for the greater part of the city, the visibility will remain relatively clear, inviting the vibrant energy of a day spent outdoors. This atmosphere lends itself well to a leisurely stroll through the streets, a chance to savor a warm cup from the local café, or perhaps engaging with the charm of nearby parks where the soft rustle of leaves will accompany your thoughts. Dress in layers; a light jacket will suffice against the cool morning air, and as the day warms, a simple sweater will keep you comfortable. It’s an ideal day to embrace the understated pleasures of life while basking in the evolving beauty of the cityscape.
